cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: cups security and bug fix update
cvrfdoc.document_distribution: Copyright Â© 2021 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

full_product_name.product_name: cups-1:2.2.6-40.el8 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream (v. 8)
cups-1:2.2.6-40.el8 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux BaseOS (v. 8)

notes.note: cups: access to uninitialized buffer in ipp.c

reference.description: bz#1921680: CVE-2020-10001 cups: access to uninitialized buffer in ipp.c

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
After installing this update, the cupsd service will be restarted automatically.

note:
An update for cups is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

The Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) provides a portable printing layer for Linux, UNIX, and similar operating systems.
Security Fix(es):
* cups: access to uninitialized buffer in ipp.c (CVE-2020-10001)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
Additional Changes:
For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.5 Release Notes linked from the References section.
